title: Project Management and Managing Risk
activities: Studied project management fundamentals including project lifecycles (Initiating, Planning, Executing, Monitoring/Controlling, Closing) and methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, PRINCE2); explored risk identification techniques (SWOT analysis, brainstorming, Delphi technique) and risk response strategies; examined change control processes; completed an assessment quiz on project management concepts.
skills: Gained competency in defining project characteristics (specific outcomes, deadlines, uniqueness); developed ability to identify, categorise, and plan for project risks; learned to apply risk response strategies (transfer, mitigation, avoidance, acceptance); understood how environmental factors influence project success.
impact: This unit provided practical frameworks for my dissertation planning and development. It will help me refine my draft research proposal timeline from Unit 10 into a formal project structure.
